ul.li: MQSeries client for your operating system
Java Runtime Environment version 1.4 or higher

section.p: In order to use MTI through MQSeries you need to be connected to the IBM Intranet. Users without access to the IBM Intranet can access MTI through a ftp connection. In order to use this connection the user needs to have an account on the IBM ftp server and be setup as MTI user on this server. No additional software is required for the ftp connection besides TM6.0.6.
The following MTI installation instruction assume that your operating system is working properly and that 6.0.6 or higher is already installed on your system.

p.i: MTI over MQSeries (requires a IBM Intranet connection)

ol.li: Open a command prompt and execute 'java -version' to verify if a Java version 1.4 or higher is already installed on your system. If Java is not installed or the installed version is lower as 1.4 please download Java version 1.4 or higher and install it on your system before continuing with the instructions below.Java 1.4 is also available for download from the MTI intranet website.
Download the MQSeries Client install image from the MTI intranet website into a temporary directory on your local disk. ( WINNT: mqcvENUS-winnt.zip ,WIN2000 and WINXP: mqcvEnUS-xp2000.zip )
Unzip the zip file content in the temporary directory on your local disc.
Start the installation of the MQSeries client with a double click on the 'Setup.exe' file.
IMPORTANT: Use the 'Compact' installation option. 'Typical' or 'Custom' will not work.
After the installation is completed successfully no further configuration for MQSeries is required. Close all installation windows. A system re-start is not required.

section.p: To be able to use the MTI function from you need to provide your MQSeries or ftp user account information in TM.
